bolt.focus: Update Performance and ISO Size Optimization
tasks: Ensure the disk space checks in `neos-autoupdate.sh` use lightweight commands (e.g., `df` vs parsing full Btrfs stats) to avoid performance regressions during the update cycle.
Verify that `airootfs/etc/sysctl.d/99-neos-performance.conf` and `airootfs/etc/modules-load.d/neos-networking.conf` settings remain active and properly impact network tuning during live sessions.
Ensure any user-facing error messages generated from `neos-autoupdate.sh` failures (e.g., insufficient disk space) are legible in logs and consider how they surface to any graphical front-end.

Review `airootfs/etc/calamares/branding/neos/neos-restore-module.qml` to verify it uses appropriate `Accessible.role` and `Accessible.name` attributes for all interactive elements to comply with WCAG AA contrast and screen-reader requirements.

sentinel.focus: Supply Chain Security and Autologin Hardening
tasks: Verify that `airootfs/usr/local/bin/neos-autoupdate.sh` checks for safe file permissions on its log and lock files, mitigating any local denial of service or symlink attacks.
Ensure the installed system's `airootfs/etc/pacman.conf` maintains strict `SigLevel = Required DatabaseRequired`.
Review the risk of the unsigned `alci_repo` in the build process `pacman.conf` and document paths to securely mirror or sign these packages.
